item.title: Install EC2 AMI & API Tools in Debian
item.description:
Download the zip files for the tools:

```bash
$ wget http://s3.amazonaws.com/ec2-downloads/ec2-api-tools.zip
$ wget http://s3.amazonaws.com/ec2-downloads/ec2-ami-tools.zip


Unzip the tools:

 ```bash
 $ unzip ec2-api-tools.zip
 $ unzip ec2-ami-tools.zip

This will give you some directories with version numbers appended. Put them in a safe place:

```bash
$ mkdir /usr/local/ec2
$ cp -r ec2-ami-tools-1.3-34544/* /usr/local/ec2/
$ cp -r ec2-api-tools-1.3-42584/* /usr/local/ec2/


Install Java:

 ```bash
 $ apt-get install sun-java6-jre

Edit the system-wide profile:

```bash
$ vi /etc/profile


Add the following to the file:

 ```bash
 # EC2 Tools
 export EC2_HOME=/usr/local/ec2
 export PATH=$PATH:$EC2_HOME/bin
 export JAVA_HOME=/usr

When someone logs in, their environment will be ready and raring to go. Users can then issue commands such as:
